definition: to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: You may vote who sever side you like.
sentences.chinese: 你可以投票选你喜欢的任一方。

sentences.english: All voting systems are open to tampering and error.
sentences.chinese: 所有的投票系统都能被人做手脚或出错。

sentences.english: One on offer . In India the poor, proportionately, are more likely to vote.
sentences.chinese: 按比例来说，印度的穷人比中产阶级更乐于参加投票。

sentences.english: They will spend it all and much more before voters pronounce the verdict.
sentences.chinese: 在选民投票前，他们将会全部花光，或者再花更多。

sentences.english: We have hundreds of constituencies and the votes in each one ele …
sentences.chinese: 我们有数百个选区，每个选区通过投票议会选举。

sentences.english: Muscovites vote in the Russia's first presdential elections. Incumbent Russian President Boris Yeltsin defeated.
sentences.chinese: 莫斯科，俄罗斯的第一次总统选举投票。

sentences.english: Daria:What topics do you vote about?
sentences.chinese: 你们投票的议题是哪些啊？

sentences.english: Militant mineworkers in the Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰激进的矿工们已经投票决定下个月罢工一天。

sentences.english: Ngoy-Mulunda is calling for the Congolese people to go and vote as that is their right.
sentences.chinese: 穆伦达呼吁刚果人民投票，因为这是他们的权利。

sentences.english: A polling station is where I vote and is listed on my Elector Information Card.
sentences.chinese: 投票站是我前往投票的地方，在选民登记列明地点。

sentences.english: A polling station is where I vote and is listed on my Elector Information Card.
sentences.chinese: 投票站是我前往投票的地方，在选民登记列明地点。
澳门立法院选举开始投票。

sentences.english: But voters will judge him by how he played it.
sentences.chinese: 但投票者将会从他干的好不好来判断他。

sentences.english: Mr. Waun added that he was 'leaning toward voting against it at this point.'
sentences.chinese: 他还说，现在自己倾向于投票反对它。

sentences.english: The union has balloted its members in pursuit of a pay claim.
sentences.chinese: 为了要求加薪，工会让其成员进行无记名投票表决。

sentences.english: Do you think this is going to affect voter turnout?
sentences.chinese: 你们是否认为这会影响选民投票率？

definition: to campaign for votes/to ask voters for support
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to read ballot slips out loud
